alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 10:28PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Denton and southeastern Cooke Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1028 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong winds from dissipating thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Sanger to near Justin. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Denton, Flower Mound, Corinth, Trophy Club, Sanger, Roanoke, Krum, Argyle, Justin, Double Oak, Northlake, Bartonville, Copper Canyon, New Fairview, Corral City, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Ponder, Road Runner, Valley View, and Dish. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 468 and 488. Interstate 35W between mile markers 72 and 85. Interstate 35E between mile markers 462 and 466. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
